The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant. Here are exceptions to this rule: 1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted. 2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted. Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines. They will investigate the code fragments you give. Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule. Provide your answer with these fields. - suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code. It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags - explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated. It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated. DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments. Here is the code of dir_reader: ```c static ssize_t dir_reader (void *cls, uint64_t pos, char *buf, size_t max) { DIR *dir = cls; struct dirent *e; int res; if (max < 512) return 0; (void) pos; /* 'pos' is ignored as function return next one single entry per call. */ do { e = readdir (dir); if (e == NULL) return MHD_CONTENT_READER_END_OF_STREAM; } while (e->d_name[0] == '.'); res = snprintf (buf, max, "%s
", e->d_name, e->d_name); if (0 >= res) return MHD_CONTENT_READER_END_WITH_ERROR; if (max < (size_t) res) return MHD_CONTENT_READER_END_WITH_ERROR; return (ssize_t) res; } ``` Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No controlling expressions in the function are invariant. Details:
- if (max < 512): depends on the function parameter max — not invariant.
- do { e = readdir(dir); ... } while (e->d_name[0] == '.');: the controlling expression depends on e->d_name which is assigned inside the loop by readdir(), so it is not invariant. (If readdir returns NULL the code returns before evaluating the condition.)
- if (e == NULL) return ...;: depends on the runtime result of readdir(), not invariant.
- if (0 >= res) and if (max < (size_t) res): both depend on the runtime value res produced by snprintf and on max, not invariant.
- The (void) pos; statement simply suppresses an unused-parameter warning and is not a controlling expression.

The allowed exceptions in MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 (infinite loops via invariant control or the special do-while constant-false case) do not apply here, and no loop condition is a compile-time or otherwise invariant expression. Therefore there are no code fragments that need investigation for Rule 14.3 in this function.
